author: timbeiko
content:
My 2c on this: I would not want to ship it alongisde London, for similar reasons why I'd rather not ship a BR increase or something like EIP-969: I think we should roll out 1559, see what happens, and deal with potential problems as they come up. 

For this specific case, we don't need a hard fork to enforce a max gas limit. If miners abuse it, we can simply run a soft fork which doesn't accept blocks with gas limit > X, and then add such an EIP in the next HF.

author: phabc
content: I changed the EIP so it's fairly EIP-1559 agnostic since it's addressing an issue that is independent of EIP-1559. Relying on a soft-fork could take days / weeks, in which we could have many blocks that are much larger size than we find acceptable. Seems to me there is little upside to leaving this up to block producers.
